member.summary: Always return false. No comparison is made.

member.summary: Return true if the source data is less than the destination data.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.ComparisonFunction.Equal
member.summary: Return true if the source data is equal to the destination data.

member.summary: Return true if the source data is less than or equal to the destination data.

member.summary: Return true if the source data is greater than the destination data.

member.summary: Return true if the source data is not equal to the destination data.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.ComparisonFunction.GreaterEqual
member.summary: Return true if the source data is greater than or equal to the destination data.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.ComparisonFunction.Always
member.summary: Always return true. No comparison is made, and all pixels pass.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mode for conservative rasterization.

member.summary: A built-in description with settings with settings for not culling any primitives.

member.summary: A built-in description with settings for culling primitives with clockwise winding order.

member.summary: A built-in description with settings for culling primitives with counter-clockwise winding order.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.RasterizerDescription.CullBackScissors
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for culling primitives with counter-clockwise winding order and scissors enabled.

member.summary: A built-in description with settings for not culling any primitives and wireframe fill mode.

member.summary: A built-in description with settings for applying depth bias.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.RasterizerDescription.CullFrontDepthBias
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for culling primitives with front-facing triangles, and applying depth bias.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.RasterizerDescription.CullBackDepthBias
member.summary: A built-in description with settings for culling primitives with back-facing triangles, and applying depth bias.

member.name: M:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Texture1D.Resize(HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Format,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.CpuAccessFlags,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.GpuAccessFlags,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.ResourceMiscFlag)
member.summary: Resizes the texture with the specified parameters.
member.param: The format of the resized texture.
The width of the resized texture.
The array size of the resized texture.
The number of mip levels for the resized texture.
The CPU access flags for the resized texture.
The GPU access flags for the resized texture (default is GpuAccessFlags.Read).
The miscellaneous flags for the resized texture (default is ResourceMiscFlag.None).
member.remarks: This method resizes the texture to the specified dimensions with the provided access flags and format. If CPU and GPU access flags conflict or GPU access flags are used for reading, appropriate bindings and usage are adjusted. After resizing, the previous texture is disposed, and new resources are created accordingly. The texture will be ready to use for rendering, shader resource, or unordered access.

member.name: M:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Texture2D.Resize(HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Format,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.CpuAccessFlags,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.GpuAccessFlags,System.Int32,System.Int32,HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.ResourceMiscFlag)
member.summary: Resizes the texture with the specified parameters.
member.param: The format of the resized texture.
The width of the resized texture.
The height of the resized texture.
The array size of the resized texture.
The number of mip levels for the resized texture.
The CPU access flags for the resized texture.
The GPU access flags for the resized texture (default is GpuAccessFlags.Read).
Specifies multisampling parameters for the texture.
Specifies multisampling parameters for the texture.
The miscellaneous flags for the resized texture (default is ResourceMiscFlag.None).
member.remarks: This method resizes the texture to the specified dimensions with the provided access flags and format. If CPU and GPU access flags conflict or GPU access flags are used for reading, appropriate bindings and usage are adjusted. After resizing, the previous texture is disposed, and new resources are created accordingly. The texture will be ready to use for rendering, shader resource, or unordered access.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.None
member.summary: No flags specified.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.LegacyDWORD
member.summary: Assume pitch is DWORD aligned instead of BYTE aligned (used by some legacy DDS files)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.NoLegacyExpansion
member.summary: Do not implicitly convert legacy formats that result in larger pixel sizes (24 bpp, 3:3:2, A8L8, A4L4, P8, A8P8)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.NoR10B10G10A2Fixup
member.summary: Do not use work-around for long-standing D3DX DDS file format issue which reversed the 10:10:10:2 color order masks

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.ForceRGB
member.summary: Convert DXGI 1.1 BGR formats to DXGI_FORMAT_R8G8B8A8_UNORM to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.1 formats

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.No16BPP
member.summary: Conversions avoid use of 565, 5551, and 4444 formats and instead expand to 8888 to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.2 formats

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.ExpandLuminance
member.summary: When loading legacy luminance formats expand replicating the color channels rather than leaving them packed (L8, L16, A8L8)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.BadDXTNTails
member.summary: Some older DXTn DDS files incorrectly handle mipchain tails for blocks smaller than 4x4

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.ForceDX10Ext
member.summary: Always use the 'DX10' header extension for DDS writer (i.e. don't try to write DX9 compatible DDS files)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.ForceDX10ExtMisc2
member.summary: FORCE_DX10_EXT including miscFlags2 information (result may not be compatible with D3DX10 or D3DX11)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.ForceDX9Legacy
member.summary: Force use of legacy header for DDS writer (will fail if unable to write as such)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.DDSFlags.AllowLargeFiles
member.summary: Enables the loader to read large dimension .dds files (i.e. greater than known hardware requirements)

member.summary: If the loaded image has an all zero alpha channel, normally we assume it should be opaque. This flag leaves it alone.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.TGAFlags.IgnoreSRGB
member.summary: Ignores sRGB TGA 2.0 metadata if present in the file

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.TGAFlags.ForceSRGB
member.summary: Writes sRGB metadata into the file reguardless of format (TGA 2.0 only)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.TGAFlags.ForceLinear
member.summary: Writes linear gamma metadata into the file reguardless of format (TGA 2.0 only)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.TGAFlags.DefaultSRGB
member.summary: If no colorspace is specified in TGA 2.0 metadata, assume sRGB

member.name: T:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags
member.summary: Flags for controlling WIC (Windows Imaging Component) file loading and saving options.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.None
member.summary: No special flags.

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.ForceRGB
member.summary: Loads DXGI 1.1 BGR formats as DXGI_FORMAT_R8G8B8A8_UNORM to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.1 formats

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.NoX2Bias
member.summary: Loads DXGI 1.1 X2 10:10:10:2 format as DXGI_FORMAT_R10G10B10A2_UNORM

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.No16BPP
member.summary: Loads 565, 5551, and 4444 formats as 8888 to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.2 formats

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.AllowMono
member.summary: Loads 1-bit monochrome (black and white) as R1_UNORM rather than 8-bit grayscale

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.AllFrames
member.summary: Loads all images in a multi-frame file, converting/resizing to match the first frame as needed, defaults to 0th frame otherwise

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.IgnoreSRGB
member.summary: Ignores sRGB metadata if present in the file

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.ForceSRGB
member.summary: Writes sRGB metadata into the file reguardless of format

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.ForceLinear
member.summary: Writes linear gamma metadata into the file reguardless of format

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.DefaultSRGB
member.summary: If no colorspace is specified, assume sRGB

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.Dither
member.summary: Use ordered 4x4 dithering for any required conversions

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.DitherDiffusion
member.summary: Use error-diffusion dithering for any required conversions

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.FilterPoint
member.summary: Filtering mode to use for any required image resizing (only needed when loading arrays of differently sized images; defaults to Fant)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.FilterLinear
member.summary: Filtering mode to use for any required image resizing (only needed when loading arrays of differently sized images; defaults to Fant)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.FilterCubic
member.summary: Filtering mode to use for any required image resizing (only needed when loading arrays of differently sized images; defaults to Fant)

member.name: F:HexaEngine.Core.Graphics.Textures.WICFlags.FilterFant
member.summary: Filtering mode to use for any required image resizing (only needed when loading arrays of differently sized images; defaults to Fant) Combination of Linear and Box filter

The duration of the rumble effect in milliseconds.

member.summary: Gets or sets if seams should be preserved. Default value: false

member.summary: Gets or sets if foldovers should be preserved. Default value: false

member.name: P:HexaEngine.Core.MeshDecimator.Algorithms.FastQuadricMeshSimplification.EnableSmartLink
member.summary: Gets or sets if a feature for smarter vertex linking should be enabled, reducing artifacts in the decimated result at the cost of a slightly more expensive initialization by treating vertices at the same position as the same vertex while separating the attributes. Default value: true

member.name: P:HexaEngine.Core.MeshDecimator.Algorithms.FastQuadricMeshSimplification.MaxIterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum iteration count. Higher number is more expensive but can bring you closer to your target quality. Sometimes a lower maximum count might be desired in order to lower the performance cost. Default value: 10000

member.name: P:HexaEngine.Core.MeshDecimator.Algorithms.FastQuadricMeshSimplification.Agressiveness
member.summary: Gets or sets the agressiveness of this algorithm. Higher number equals higher quality, but more expensive to run. Default value: 10.0

member.name: P:HexaEngine.Core.MeshDecimator.Algorithms.FastQuadricMeshSimplification.VertexLinkDistanceSqr
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum squared distance between two vertices in order to link them. Note that this value is only used if EnableSmartLink is true. Default value: double.Epsilon

member.name: T:HexaEngine.Core.Security.Cryptography.Crc32
member.summary: Implements a 32-bit CRC hash algorithm compatible with Zip etc.
member.remarks: Crc32 should only be used for backward compatibility with older file formats and algorithms. It is not secure enough for new applications. If you need to call multiple times for the same data either use the HashAlgorithm interface or remember that the result of one Compute call needs to be ~ (XOR) before being passed in as the seed for the next Compute call.
